isis.stitle: DCM AND DDM DRUM TYPE PARKING BRAKE - ROCKWELL DUPLEX CAM MECHANICAL BRAKE - CLEANING, INSPECTION AND REPAIR

svcsubproc.title: Cleaning
svcsubproc.para: Protect the brake lining from solvents, lubricants, or other contaminants that can change the friction properties of the lining. Contaminated linings must be replaced.

Use an approved brake parts cleaner. OSHA recommends that enclosed cylinders equipped with vacuums and high-efficiency (HEPA) filters be used in brake repairs. Under this system, the entire brake assem- bly is placed within the cylinder and the mechanic works through sleeves in the cylinder. Compressed air is blown into the cylinder to clean the assembly, and dirty air is removed from the cylinder by the vacuum.

If such an assembly is not available, you must carefully clean the brake assembly in the open air. During disassembly, all parts should be carefully placed on the floor to minimize the creation of airborne brake dust. Dust should be first cleaned from the brake drum, backing plate, and brake assembly using an industrial vacuum cleaner equipped with a (HEPA) filter system. After vacuum cleaning, any remaining dust should be removed using a rag soaked in water and wrung until nearly dry.

warning.para: Compressed air and open dry brushing should NEVER be used for cleaning brake assemblies. Exposure to airborne brake dust can cause serious or fatal diseases.

svcsubproc.title: Inspection and Repair
svcsubproc.para: It is important that you carefully inspect all parts before assembly starts. Check all parts for wear or damage and repair or replace any damaged, broken, worn or questionable parts. Some key things to check for are:

step1.para: Check backing plate for distortion or loose anchor pins.
Check the hole that the cam rotates in for elongation and wear.
Check actuator strut for wear at the cam slot and pressure points at both shoes.
Check both shoes for rust, expanded rivet holes, broken welds and correct alignment. Check for shoe square to the backing plate.
Check brake drums for cracks, severe heat checking, heat spotting, scoring, pitting, distortion, and excessive inside diameter.
If lining material is worn to .100 inch (2.5 mm) or within 0.020 inch (.51 mm) of rivet head at thinnest point, replace lining, or shoe and lining assemblies.
